High Court Division, Bangladesh

Md. Rahman v. State of Bangladesh

Case No: Criminal Appeal No. 123/1997

Citation: 22 (1998) DLR (HCD) 205

Date of Judgment: 15th March, 1998

Date of Filing: 20th May, 1997

Date of Hearing: 10th February, 1998

BEFORE:

Hon'ble Justice Md. Tafazzul Islam, J.

Hon'ble Justice A.B.M. Khairul Haque, J.

Appellant: Md. Rahman

Respondent: State of Bangladesh

JUDGMENT

Justice Md. Tafazzul Islam, J. (Majority Opinion):

This is an appeal against the conviction and sentence passed by the Court of Session, Dhaka under Section 302 of the Penal Code, 1860. The appellant was convicted for the murder of the deceased and sentenced to death.

The facts of the case are as follows: The appellant and the deceased had a long-standing dispute over land. On the fateful day, they had an altercation which resulted in the appellant attacking the deceased with a sharp weapon.

Sections Cited

The following statutory provisions are relevant:

  • Section 302 of the Penal Code, 1860 - Murder
  • Section 300 of the Penal Code, 1860 - Definition of murder
  • Article 14 of the Constitution of Bangladesh - Equality before law

Case Law Cited

The following precedents were considered:

  • Abdul Khaleque v. State, 18 (1993) BLD 125
  • State v. Shamsul Haque, 15 (1990) DLR (AD) 45
  • Ram Prasad v. State of Bihar, AIR 1975 SC 1250

Decision

After careful consideration of the evidence and legal principles, we find that the conviction under Section 302 of the Penal Code is not sustainable. The prosecution has failed to establish the guilt beyond reasonable doubt.

Accordingly, the appeal is allowed. The conviction and sentence are set aside. The appellant is acquitted of the charges.

Justice A.B.M. Khairul Haque, J. (Concurring Opinion):

I agree with the conclusion reached by my learned brother.
